title: Linkedin account restricted
content:
[8/20, 5:06 PM] Abdikoo123: Dear LinkedIn Team,

I hope this message finds you well. My LinkedIn account, which holds a significant number of connections and followers, has been unexpectedly restricted. Unfortunately, I’m currently unable to log in and verify my identity due to challenges with OTP delivery and account access.

This situation is impacting my business activities and professional engagement on the platform. I would be truly grateful for your prompt assistance in helping me resolve this issue and regain access to my account.

Thank you for your support.

Warm regards, Abdi [8/20, 5:06 PM] Abdikoo123: https://www.linkedin.com/help/linkedin/ask/default-social?lang=en-USz [8/20, 5:06 PM] Abdikoo123: Subject: Request for Urgent Assistance – Account Access Issue [8/20, 5:07 PM] Abdikoo123: Dear LinkedIn Team,

I hope this message finds you well. My LinkedIn account, which holds a significant number of connections and followers, has been unexpectedly restricted. Unfortunately, I’m currently unable to log in and verify my identity due to challenges with OTP delivery and account access.

This situation is impacting my business activities and professional engagement on the platform. I would be truly grateful for your prompt assistance in helping me resolve this issue and regain access to my account.

Thank you for your support.

title: Majort issue with cross-site use of certificates?
content:
I have two websites of my own. I am viewing one and it is correct. When I view the other, it uses the https cert from the first one, and says my site is not secure. I have viewed the cert, and it is definitely correct. I think Mozilla is probably caching old information - the certs have been correct for most of 2025, so it is a pretty old version. Therefore, it is not actually caching the cert, but caching which cert it should use. I have tried clearing the cache, and it did not help!

Has Mozilla got some kind of cache I can't clear? Should it not re-read the cert when it loads the site, or at least the cert date, each time it reads the site (ie was not previously showing it on screen)?

title: Website's Webpage Disappears When Clicking On It
content:
Hello-

I have an issue with secondary webpages disappearing. Occasionally, when I am on a website, particularly when I am buying something or comparing items and a pop-out page appears showing what you selected, when I go to click on that 'secondary' webpage it disappears. It's not hidden between other open browsers or appearing on the taskbar. It's just gone. When I go back to the main webpage site and open up this pop-out page again, it will reappear. But the moment I click on this pop-out page it disappears. An example is attached with a DoorDash progress order. It seems that it only happens with "secondary" pop-out pages. It does not occur if the website creates a whole separate new non-pop-out page.

I went into settings to try turning off and on pop-up to see if that does something but nothing. Thanks for your help in advance.
creator: StevenLAX16

title: Firefox - macOS - reddit problems again
content:
Firefox: 142.0.1 (64-bit) macOS: Sequoia 15.6.1 (24G90)

A repeat of a problem I was having a couple of months ago. I go to the reddit website and login with no problems but when I try to comment or load specific threads I get the attached warning come up:

"! Your request has been blocked by network security. Please try to login with your Redit account."

Which doesn't make sense as I'm already logged in. Last time it seemed to clear after 24 hours or so although not because of anything I did as far as I'm aware.

1. Started Firefox in Troubleshoot Mode - problem remains … 2. Cleared Firefox Cache/Cookies and restarted Firefox - problem remains … 3. Shutdown and restarted iMac - problem remains … 4. Problem not happening with Safari or DuckDuckGo browsers … 5. Checked macOS Local Network security. Firefox has access but turned off access and turned back on, restarted iMac - problem remains …

title: Consider toolbar is not a part of titlebar pls.
content:
Here is the problem I have: I'm using Linux Mint 22.2 Cinnamon 6.4.8, which has a feature of **Dragging Maximum Window titlebar makes Window Restore Down/Unmaximum**, which also is a feature that Windows has since Vista. I don't like this feature so I disabled it on Windows, but when I tried to disable it on Linux Mint, I realize the setting was broken for a very long time. Only Window to Maximum can be prevented but not Unmaximum.

I think the Linux Mint Developer will not fix it, so what I can do is only to **Just not drag Maximum Window's Titlebar** Here is the issue: **Firefox consider toolbar/bookmark as a part of its titlebar.** When I click or drag the gaps of toolbar, it is considered as titlebar. When this happens, the Maximum Firefox Window gets unmaximum, which is very annoying.

Here is a video I recorded to explain it: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_K7y7MRRKy4>

Is there a way to make the toolbar not a part of titlebar?

title: Very infrequently, Firefox starts processing all inputs or actions with a ~10s delay
content:
Every few weeks at random I have the same problem: Any action I take on tabs (e.g. close tab, open new one), as well as any typing I perform, only creates the normal effect after around 10s of delay. I can type whole sentences and nothing happens until 10s later the whole sentence starts appearing as if I had just typed it. The hamburger menu and about dialog where not impacted from this delay.

The CPU and memory load shows no signs of being a bottleneck and nothing performance hungry is happening in the rest of the system.

This happened around 2min after startup, after 5h of work, or anywhere in-between.

Workaround is a browser restart, but it is quite annoying if this occurs while I'm filling in a form and I have to start over.

Ubuntu 24.04 - snap package Once the issue occurred, I disabled all extensions (without restart), but the issue continued.
creator: felix.s

title: Why can't Mozilla Support in simplified Chinese language Ask a Question?
content: Hello, I encountered this issue while trying to Ask a Question in Simplified Chinese. For example, Firefox's Chinese Simplified Language Support page.On the Simplified Chinese page (https://support.mozilla.org/zh-CN/questions/new/firefox), clicking the "Continue" option in the "Ask a Question" section redirects to https://support.mozilla.org/zh-CN/kb/%E8%8E%B7%E5%BE%97%E7%A4%BE%E5%8C%BA%E6%94%AF%E6%8C%81?exit_aaq=1. Then, clicking "GET HELP" redirects back to https://support.mozilla.org/zh-CN/questions/new/firefox. Under normal circumstances, it should redirect to the Question submission page. This feature works correctly on the English-language Mozilla Support page (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/new/firefox/form). I attempted to change the language identifier in the English page URL from "en-US" to "zh-CN," which resulted in a prompt stating: "The question forum cannot be used for Firefox in Chinese (Simplified). We have redirected you to the English question forum." And I found that none of the ask a question in Support can be used in simplified Chinese language. I tried to ask Mozilla Support, but I didn't get valid information.
creator: zhengyang3552
